data.name: AvoidExpectedExceptionAttributeDescription
data.value: Prefer 'Assert.ThrowsException' or 'Assert.ThrowsExceptionAsync' over '[ExpectedException]' as it ensures that only the expected call throws the expected exception. The assert APIs also provide more flexibility and allow you to assert extra properties of the exeption.

data.name: AvoidExpectedExceptionAttributeMessageFormat
data.value: Prefer 'Assert.ThrowsException/ThrowsExceptionAsync' over '[ExpectedException]'

data.name: AvoidExpectedExceptionAttributeTitle
data.value: Avoid '[ExpectedException]'

data.name: PriorityAttributeOnTestMethodAnalyzerDescription
data.value: [Priority] can only be set on methods marked with [TestMethod].

data.name: PriorityAttributeOnTestMethodAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: [Priority] can only be set on methods marked with [TestMethod]

data.name: PriorityAttributeOnTestMethodAnalyzerTitle
data.value: PriorityAttribute should be set on TestMethod

data.name: PublicTypeShouldBeTestClassDescription
data.value: It's considered a good practice to have only test classes marked public in a test project.

data.name: PublicTypeShouldBeTestClassMessageFormat
data.value: Public type '{0}' should be marked with '[TestClass]' or changed to 'internal'

data.name: PublicTypeShouldBeTestClassTitle
data.value: Public types should be test classes

data.name: TestClassShouldBeValidDescription
data.value: Test classes, classes marked with the '[TestClass]' attribute, should respect the following layout to be considered valid by MSTest: - it should be 'public' (or 'internal' if '[assembly: DiscoverInternals]' attribute is set) - it should not be 'static' (except if it contains only 'AssemblyInitialize' and/or 'AssemblyCleanup' methods) - it should not be generic.

data.name: TestClassShouldBeValidMessageFormat_NotGeneric
data.value: Test class '{0}' should not be generic

data.name: TestClassShouldBeValidMessageFormat_NotStatic
data.value: Test class '{0}' should not be 'static'

data.name: TestClassShouldBeValidMessageFormat_Public
data.value: Test class '{0}' should be 'public'

data.name: TestClassShouldBeValidMessageFormat_PublicOrInternal
data.value: Test class '{0}' should be 'public' or 'internal'

data.name: TestClassShouldBeValidTitle
data.value: Test classes should have valid layout

data.name: TestContextShouldBeValidDescription
data.value: TestContext property should follow the following layout to be valid: - it should be a property - it should be 'public' (or 'internal' if '[assembly: DiscoverInternals]' attribute is set) - it should not be 'static' - it should not be readonly.

data.name: TestContextShouldBeValidMessageFormat_NotField
data.value: Member 'TestContext' should be a property and not a field

data.name: TestContextShouldBeValidMessageFormat_NotReadonly
data.value: Property 'TestContext' should be settable

data.name: TestContextShouldBeValidMessageFormat_NotStatic
data.value: Property 'TestContext' should not be 'static'

data.name: TestContextShouldBeValidMessageFormat_Public
data.value: Property 'TestContext' should be 'public'

data.name: TestContextShouldBeValidMessageFormat_PublicOrInternal
data.value: Property 'TestContext' should be 'public' or 'internal'

data.name: TestContextShouldBeValidTitle
data.value: Test context property should have valid layout

data.name: TestMethodShouldBeValidDescription
data.value: Test methods, methods marked with the '[TestMethod]' attribute, should respect the following layout to be considered valid by MSTest: - it should be 'public' (or 'internal' if '[assembly: DiscoverInternals]' attribute is set) - it should not be 'static' - it should not be generic - it should not be 'abstract' - return type should be 'void' or 'Task' - it should not be 'async void' - it should be a special method (finalizer, operator...).

data.name: TestMethodShouldBeValidMessageFormat_NotAbstract
data.value: Test method '{0}' should not be 'abstract'

data.name: TestMethodShouldBeValidMessageFormat_NotAsyncVoid
data.value: Test method '{0}' should not be 'async void'

data.name: TestMethodShouldBeValidMessageFormat_NotGeneric
data.value: Test method '{0}' should not be generic

data.name: TestMethodShouldBeValidMessageFormat_NotStatic
data.value: Test method '{0}' should not be 'static'

data.name: TestMethodShouldBeValidMessageFormat_Ordinary
data.value: Test method '{0}' should be an 'ordinary' method

data.name: TestMethodShouldBeValidMessageFormat_Public
data.value: Test method '{0}' should be 'public'

data.name: TestMethodShouldBeValidMessageFormat_PublicOrInternal
data.value: Test method '{0}' should be 'public' or 'internal'

data.name: TestMethodShouldBeValidMessageFormat_ReturnType
data.value: Test method '{0}' should return 'void' or 'Task'

data.name: TestMethodShouldBeValidTitle
data.value: Test methods should have valid layout

data.name: UseParallelizeAttributeAnalyzerDescription
data.value: By default, MSTest runs tests within the same assembly sequentially, which can lead to severe performance limitations. It is recommended to enable assembly attribute '[Parallelize]' to run tests in parallel, or if the assembly is known to not be parallelizable, to use explicitly the assembly level attribute '[DoNotParallelize]'.

data.name: UseParallelizeAttributeAnalyzerMessageFormat
data.value: Explicitly enable or disable tests parallelization

data.name: UseParallelizeAttributeAnalyzerTitle
data.value: Explicitly enable or disable tests parallelization
